text: [Music]
in many organizations people's
leadership readiness is measured by
their willingness to speak up in
meetings
how you speak off the cuff can have a
bigger impact on your career trajectory
than your presentations or speeches
meetings provide an opportunity to
create an impact move up in your career
and bring others with you
here are three strategies to help you
speak up effectively prepare a few
points in advance instead of waiting for
inspiration to strike in a meeting if
public speaking makes you anxious this
practice lets you challenge yourself to
speak up without the worry of what to
say ask why you
before you craft a presentation or walk
into a meeting
this means
why do you care about what you do
about your organization or your role
answering this question will help you
find purpose and build confidence
it reminds you that you're speaking up
not to show off but because you are
committed and passionate about the
subject
pause and breathe to build your
confidence doing so centers you and
strengthens your voice so that when you
do speak up you speak with conviction
while you pause ask yourself
if one other person in this room has the
same question am i willing to ask on
behalf of the other person the answer
will build your confidence at times the
person who says the least in a meeting
holds the most power
your executive presence comes from being
strategic about when you speak up and
what you say
watch for these three warning signs to
know when you should hold back
if you're only trying to show how much
you know
it's better to let someone else talk or
let the meeting run its natural course
so ask yourself why you are speaking
before you do
if you are a leader trying to empower
your team it's good to let members find
their own solution
letting others speak up in meetings with
your clients will help build their
leadership skills raise their visibility
and give clients a greater sense of
support from your whole team
if your comment would be better left for
a one-on-one conversation
save it for later to mitigate difficult
conversations within the organization
email or speak to someone privately
rather than addressing the issue in a
group where the person will feel
defensive
bottom line speaking up in a meeting is
one of the single most effective ways to
raise your visibility and build a
relationship of trust with your clients
and colleagues practice it strategically
every day and you will have a powerful
impact on your career and in your
business
[Music]
